comments.body:
I think this might be a little overkill :wink: - we'll end up jinja-ing out the whole thing :smile: 

Would you mind if this were just version, and the other two were inlined?
Sorry, maybe I did get a little carried away. I was [inspired](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/177). :smile:

Just saw that and commented. :+1: for being inspired by our collaborators - that is what this is all about :+1: 

Let's resolve that in one place, and we can move forwards from there.

Unrelated question to the jinja templating, do you know if we can both restrict version and use `x.x`?

I didn't see a good example, but I did try a few things and didn't find any that really worked. Admittedly, I have seen this work on NumPy's as old as 1.7 (and that may not even be the lower limit) so it isn't a big deal if it can't be done. After all, it definitely will work with NumPy's we do build with.

You can specify numpy twice, once with the `x.x` and once with the condition. i.e.

```
requirements:
  build:
   numpy x.x
   numpy >=1.8
   python
```
Interesting, for some reason I was thinking they would need to be on the same line. Thanks. Have updated accordingly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@    - python
    - setuptools >=18.0
    - numpy x.x
    - numpy >=1.7
    - cython >=0.23

comments.body: Technically this isn't needed - it can only be a numpy which was a suitable build version (which is >=1.7 anyway).

You're right. This is basically irrelevant. In practice, I am doing my CI against 1.10.x so I don't know how true this still is. Though I am not using any recent features from NumPy only standard things like `shape`, `reshape`, and such. Figured I would be explicit though.
